intro: Babiana confusa, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces a bulbous stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in drought conditions. Babiana confusa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
